moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. cxd5 exd5 4. Nc3 b6: Another popular moves in this variation are , 4...Nf6,4...Be7,4...Bb4, 4...Bf5 .
moves.5. Bf4: Develop my DBS to active position ,controlling the e5 squarer and the h2-b8 diagonal is very important .
moves.5... Bb7 6. e3: Protect the central d pawn and open the diagonal for the other bishop .
moves.6... a6: Preparing 7...b5 ,...c5  pawn advance on the queens side .
moves.7. h3: The idea is to keep my bishop on the long diagonal h2-b8 , in case black would chase my bishop by ...Nf6-Nh5 manuever after Nf3 of course . the idea is also not showing black where I am going to place my peisces .
moves.7... Nf6 8. Bd3: Develop my LBS to another good diagonal b1-h7 , preparing Qc2  building battery on the diagonal b1-h7 and avoiding moves like ...Ne4 . Using the fact that black didn't develop his DBS to e7 or d6 , I prefer to move my bishop first , with the idea after black will try to exchange bishops on f4 ,the knight on g1 will move to e2 and I will keep my pawn stricture on the kings side and I wont help black to develop his queen after Bxd6 . and if 8...Be7 than 9.Nf3 with the idea of ...Bd6 will be a waist of time since the bishop was already have been developed to e7 .
moves.12... Bxf4 13. fxe4: mistake , losing a pawn with not enough compensation . Better was 13.Nxf4-Nf6.14.g4-h6.15.Rae1-c5.16.h4-Nc6 .17.dxc-Nb4...
moves.13... Bxe3+ 14. Kh1 dxe4 15. Nxe4 Qd5: Mistake , gives back a pawn for free , after 15...Nc6!.16.N4c3-NB4.17.Bxh7+Kh8.18.Qb1-Qh4.19.Bf5-Bxd4.20.Bg4.... with big advantage for black .
moves.16. Qxc7 Nd7 17. Ne2c3 Qxd4: Bad mistake , black blunders a piece , after 17..Qc6!18.Qxc6-Bxc6.19.Nd6-Bxd4.20.Nxe8-Rxe8.21.Rad1-Bxc3.22.bxc ... and white is much better but at least black is steel can fight back .
moves.18. Qxb7 Qxd3 19. Rad1 Rab8 20. Qxd7 Qxd: Get away from the pine on the knight on e4 and attacking the bishop .
moves.23... f5: Because of lost of time black loses his bishop .better was 23...Bc5.24.g4-Re5.25.Kg2-f5.26.gxf-Rxf5.27.Nxc5-bxc.28.b3... with wining position for white .
moves.24. Nxf2: Black resigns . With 2 knights advantage there is no use to keep playing the game . thank you I hop you enjoyed the game .
